intro: Stenomesson pauciflorum var. pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered stenomesson, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in late summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, this plant is adapted to survive in dry conditions. It produces seeds in a small, disk-like structure, and its growth habit is often prostrate or spreading. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
